text:
Carlton is a city in Dickinson County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 42 people lived there.
History.
Carlton was a station and shipping point on the Missouri Pacific Railroad.
A post office was opened in Carlton in 1872, and remained in operation until it was closed in 1995.
Geography.
Carlton is found at (38.686786, -97.294015).
The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 42 people, 16 households, and 14 families living in Carlton.
Education.
Carlton is a part of USD 473 Chapman. The Chapman High School mascot is Chapman Fighting Irish.
